full_text: Form 9-118A=St.Paul 12-10-47 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 1014 New Post Office Building Saint Paul 1, Minnesota Maoling Liu April 19, 1949 0900/33210 630 Lincoln N. E., Minneapolis, Minn. Dear Sir: Referring to your entry into the United States as a Section 4(e) student, will you kindly answer the questions listed below, sign your name and then request the Registrar of the school you are attending to certify that the information given by you is true and cor- rect. A franked addressed envelope is enclosed for your convenience in making reply. Very truly yours, Irvin F. Shrode Officer in Charge St. s MAY B 1939 By: J. D. Perfetto Assistant Officer in Charge 1. Are you attending the UNIV. OF MINN (school) A. Yes 2. How many semester hours of work do you carry? A. 6 + Thesis * 3. Is this a full course of study in day classes? A. Yes 4. Are you making passing grades in all of your subjects? A. Yes 5. Are you employed? A. Yes If you are employed, please give full particulars on the reverse of this page. Date: APRIL 22, 1949 0900/33210 mashing Signature of Student Line but File No. APRIL 26, Note: The Registrar will please add his comments in the space below, 7/7/19 and mail to U. S. Immigration and Naturalization Service, 1014 New Post Office Building, St. Paul 1, Minnesota. Greending Coverly to hisadview Ever) Prof this L.C. hiring the fall green hu.
